title: DDoS Attacks
description: What is a DDoS attack? Why is it dangerous?

content.content: A DDoS attack, or a Distributed Denial-Of-Service attack, is an onslaught of internet traffic unleashed in order to overload a target server and prevent it from functioning properly. You may have even experienced this yourself; a common motive for DDoS attacks is to effectively shut down popular websites and other services. In order words, they are denying this service to users.
A DDoS attack utilizes a network of computers infected with malware in order to coordinate strikes against servers. This is how the volume of internet traffic is created.
What is the difference between DoS and DDoS?

DoS attacks are similar to DDoS attacks, except smaller in scale. Both seek to overwhelm a server with the goal of denying service, but DoS attacks only utilize one computer, whereas a DDoS uses a network of computers.
